title: Boudin Sausage
instructions:
1. In a large sauce pan, combine the pork butt, pork liver, water, onions, garlic, bell peppers, celery, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon cayenne, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Bring the liquid up to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Simmer for 1 1/12 hours, or until the pork and liver are tender. Remove from the heat and drain, reserving 1 1/2 cups of the broth.
  2. Using a meat grinder with a 1/4-inch die, grind the pork mixture. 1/2 cup of the parsley, and 1/2 cup of the green onions, together. Turn the mixture into a mixing bowl. Stir in the rice, remaining salt, cayenne, black pepper, parsley, and green onions. Add the broth, 1/2 cup at a time, and mix thoroughly. Either using a feeding tube or a funnel, stuff the sausage into the casings and make 3-inch links.
  3. Bring 1 gallon of salted water up to a boil. Poach the sausage for about 5 minutes, or until the sausage is firm to the touch and plump. Remove from the water and allow to cool.

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup chopped green onions tops (green part only)
extendedIngredients.name: onion

extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 1/2 pounds pork butt, cut into 1" cubes
extendedIngredients.name: pork butt

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound pork liver, rinsed in cool water
extendedIngredients.name: pork liver

extendedIngredients.originalString: sausage casings, 1 1/2" diameter, about 4 feet in length
extendedIngredients.name: sausage
